node.statement: Edge smoothing via Lagrangian rounding: Along each edge e of K where exactly 2 Lagrangian faces meet, the dihedral singularity admits a local Lagrangian smoothing supported in a tubular neighborhood of e. In adapted symplectic coordinates the two half-planes differ only in a transverse profile; replace the V-shaped profile with a smooth convex curve, then apply a Moser-type correction (using omega|_{K_mollified} = d(alpha_epsilon) with |alpha_epsilon|=O(epsilon)) to restore the exact Lagrangian condition. The correction is generated by a compactly supported Hamiltonian.
